Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Competitor \Com*pet"i*tor\, n. [L.: cf. F. comp['e]titeur.] 1. One who seeks what another seeks, or claims what another claims; one who competes; a rival. [1913 Webster]
And can not brook competitors in love. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
2. An associate; a confederate. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
Every hour more competitors Flock to their aid, and still their power increaseth. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
competitor n : the contestant you hope to defeat; "he had respect for his rivals"; "he wanted to know what the competition was doing" [syn: {rival}, {challenger}, {competition}, {contender}]
